Detailed Description

The application undo stack.

Member Function Documentation

void DzUndoStack::accept ( const QString &  caption  )  [slot]

It is recommended that you use the DzUndoStackHold object instead of calling this function directly to avoid leaving the undo stack open. Finishes the hold and pushes the undo list onto the stack. If the stack is already at maximum depth, it pushes the oldest item off of the list.

Parameters:
caption A descriptive string to dispaly for the undo list.
See also:
DzUndoStackHold
void DzUndoStack::beginHold (  )  [slot]

It is recommended that you use the DzUndoStackHold object instead of calling this function directly to avoid leaving the undo stack open. Begins a hold, collecting all undo items into one undo entry. Every call to begin hold must be matched by a call to accept() or cancel().

See also:
DzUndoStackHold
void DzUndoStack::cancel (  )  [slot]

It is recommended that you use the DzUndoStackHold object instead of calling this function directly to avoid leaving the undo stack open. Finishes the hold but immediately calls undo to restore the state of the database to what it was before the matching beginHold() call.

See also:
DzUndoStackHold
bool DzUndoStack::canPushItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if undo items can be pushed onto the stack.
bool DzUndoStack::canRedo (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if redo() can be called.
bool DzUndoStack::canUndo (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if undo() can be called.
void DzUndoStack::clearAll (  )  [slot]

Clears the undo stack. This must be called at least whenever the database changes.

void DzUndoStack::drop (  )  [slot]

It is recommended that you use the DzUndoStackHold object instead of calling this function directly to avoid leaving the undo stack open. Accepts the actions performed and closes the undo stack hold without adding the items to the undo stack - the memory associated with the items is freed.

See also:
DzUndoStackHold
int DzUndoStack::getNumItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The total number of items in the undo stack.
int DzUndoStack::getNumRedoItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The total number of list items on the redo stack.
int DzUndoStack::getNumUndoItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The total number of list items on the undo stack.
QString DzUndoStack::getRedoCaption (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The caption assigned to the redo item at the top of the stack.
QString DzUndoStack::getUndoCaption (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The caption assigned to the undo item at the top of the stack.
bool DzUndoStack::hasItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if there are items on the undo stack.
bool DzUndoStack::isInUndoRedo (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if the undo stack is currently engaged in an undo/redo operation. This is useful for items that need to perform certain operations if the undo stack is not the one effecting data changes.
void DzUndoStack::lock (  )  [slot]

Disable items from being pushed onto the stack. this will be toggled by items to prevent undo operations from creating new undo items during an undo. Every call to lock() must be matched by a call to unlock().

bool DzUndoStack::push ( DzUndoItem *  item  )  [slot]

Push a new item onto the current hold entry. Returns FALSE if there is no hold active.

Parameters:
item The item to add to the undo stack. The undo stack takes ownership of this object and deletes it when it is no longer needed.
bool DzUndoStack::redo (  )  [slot]

Calls redo on the item at the top of the stack, then moves the pointer to the next item in the stack.

Returns:
true on success, false on error or if the stack is empty.
DzUndoStack::redoAvailable ( bool  yesNo  )  [signal]

Emmitted when the availability of the redo stack changes.

DzUndoStack::redoCaptionChanged ( const QString &  caption  )  [signal]

Emmitted when the caption of the redo stack changes.

bool DzUndoStack::undo (  )  [slot]

Calls undo on the item at the top of the stack, then moves the pointer to the previous item in the stack.

Returns:
true if successful, false on error or if the stack is empty.
DzUndoStack::undoAvailable ( bool  yesNo  )  [signal]

Emmitted when the availability of the undo stack changes.

DzUndoStack::undoCaptionChanged ( const QString &  caption  )  [signal]

Emmitted when the caption of the undo stack changes.

void DzUndoStack::unlock (  )  [slot]

Enable items to be pushed onto the stack after a lock() call.
